titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: There were 21 comts at 8 a.m.: & 32 at 11 a.m.

Congregations were very large both at Mattins & at Evensong. I preached twice, making my sermons rather briefer than usual in deference to the lengthening conditions of the day. In the afternoon Gilbert & I walked with "Logic" across Hyde Park. The Offertories throughout the day reached the respectable amount of £25.17.1. It is interesting to note that throughout Lent the Offertories have ranged from £22 to £28 every Sunday. This is a substantial improvement from former years; I myself have been preacher twice every Sunday.
